history.proof: intros x. sauto lq: on depth: 3.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall x : Rbar, Rbar_le x x

Premises:
Inductive Rbar : Set := Finite : R -> Rbar | p_infty : Rbar | m_infty : Rbar For Finite: Argument scope is [R_scope]
Rbar_le = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => match y with | Finite y0 => x0 <= y0 | p_infty => True | m_infty => False end | p_infty => match y with | p_infty => True | _ => False end | m_infty => True end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
Rbar_not_lt_le : forall x y : Rbar, ~ Rbar_lt x y -> Rbar_le y x
Rbar_not_le_lt : forall x y : Rbar, ~ Rbar_le x y -> Rbar_lt y x
Rbar_le_not_lt : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_le y x -> ~ Rbar_lt x y
Rbar_lt_not_le : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_lt y x -> ~ Rbar_le x y
Rbar_lt_not_eq : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_lt x y -> x <> y
Rbar_plus_correct : forall x y : Rbar, ex_Rbar_plus x y -> is_Rbar_plus x y (Rbar_plus x y)
Rbar_mult_correct : forall x y : Rbar, ex_Rbar_mult x y -> is_Rbar_mult x y (Rbar_mult x y)
is_finite_correct : forall x : Rbar, is_finite x < -> (exists y : R, x = y)
Rbar_mult_correct' : forall x y z : Rbar, is_Rbar_mult x y z -> ex_Rbar_mult x y
is_Rbar_mult_unique : forall x y z : Rbar, is_Rbar_mult x y z -> Rbar_mult x y = z
is_Rbar_plus_unique : forall x y z : Rbar, is_Rbar_plus x y z -> Rbar_plus x y = z
sqrt_positivity : forall x : R, 0 <= x -> 0 <= sqrt x
Rbar_finite_eq : forall x y : R, x = y < -> x = y
Rbar_finite_neq : forall x y : R, x <> y < -> x <> y
Rabs_pos : forall x : R, 0 <= Rabs x
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y...
ZMicromega.Vars.Facts.MP.Dec.F.inter_iff : forall (s s' : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) (x : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt), FSetPositive.PositiveSet.In x (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.inter s s') < -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.In x s /\ FSetPositive.PositiveSet.In x s'
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.remove_1 : forall (s : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) (x y : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt), x = y -> ~ FSetPositive.PositiveSet.In y (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.remove x s)
ZMicromega.Vars.Facts.MP.Dec.F.remove_iff : forall (s : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) (x y : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt), FSetPositive.PositiveSet.In y (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.remove x s) < -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.In y s /\ x <> y
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.remove_2 : forall (s : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) (x y : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt), x <> y -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.In y s -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.In y (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.remove x s)
N.lt_irrefl : forall x : N, ~ (x < x)%N
is_finite = fun x : Rbar => x = x : Rbar -> Prop
cadd_ext : forall (C : Type) (cadd cmul : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceq : C -> C -> Prop), ring_eq_ext cadd cmul copp ceq -> forall x y : C, ceq x y -> forall x0 y0 : C, ceq x0 y0 -> ceq (cadd x x0) (cadd y y0)
RiemannInt_P19 : forall (f g : R -> R) (a b : R) (pr1 : Riemann_integrable f a b) (pr2 : Riemann_integrable g a b), a <= b -> (forall x : R, a < x < b -> f x <= g x) -> RiemannInt pr1 <= RiemannInt pr2
RiemannInt_P18 : forall (f g : R -> R) (a b : R) (pr1 : Riemann_integrable f a b) (pr2 : Riemann_integrable g a b), a <= b -> (forall x : R, a < x < b -> f x = g x) -> RiemannInt pr1 = RiemannInt pr2

```coq
intros x.
destruct x as [x | | ]; simpl;
  try (intros; constructor); auto.
Qed.```
